title: Computer Science Bachelor's Degree
content: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science at Northeastern University combines theoretical foundations with hands-on experience through our renowned co-op program. Students learn programming, algorithms, data structures, software engineering, and more. The program includes opportunities to specialize in areas like artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, game development, and human-computer interaction.

title: MBA Program Overview
content: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) at Northeastern University's D'Amore-McKim School of Business prepares students for leadership roles in today's dynamic business environment. The program offers concentrations in finance, marketing, supply chain management, and entrepreneurship. Students gain real-world experience through consulting projects and co-op opportunities.

title: Undergraduate Admission Requirements
content: Northeastern University seeks students who demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a passion for experiential learning. Application requirements include: high school transcript with strong grades in challenging courses, SAT or ACT scores (test-optional for recent admissions cycles), letters of recommendation, personal essay, and demonstrated extracurricular involvement. The middle 50% of admitted students have SAT scores ranging from 1430-1540 and ACT scores from 33-35.

title: Co-op Program Information
content: Northeastern's signature co-op program allows students to alternate semesters of full-time study with full-time professional work experiences. Students typically complete 1-3 co-ops during their undergraduate career, working for leading companies and organizations around the world. Co-op positions are paid and provide invaluable real-world experience, helping students clarify career goals, build professional networks, and often leading to full-time job offers upon graduation.

title: Campus Housing Options
content: Northeastern University offers a variety of on-campus housing options for students. First-year students are guaranteed housing in residence halls with traditional doubles and community bathrooms. Upper-class students can choose from apartment-style housing, suite-style residences, and special interest housing. All residence halls feature study lounges, laundry facilities, and 24/7 security. Popular residence halls include International Village, West Village, and Light Hall.
